block.p: Major League Baseball COMMISSIONER'S OFFICE--Denied the New York Mets' protest of their game against the New York Yankees on July 8. Reduced the suspension of Pittsburgh pitching coach Pete Vuckovich from three to two games. Suspended Colorado OF Brian Hunter and Cincinnati RHP Scott Sullivan three games and fined them an undisclosed amount for an altercation during a game on July 15.

Major League Baseball COMMISSIONER'S OFFICE--Denied the New York Mets' protest of their game against the New York Yankees on July 8. Reduced the suspension of Pittsburgh pitching coach Pete Vuckovich from three to two games. Suspended Colorado OF Brian Hunter and Cincinnati RHP Scott Sullivan three games and fined them an undisclosed amount for an altercation during a game on July 15.

American League BALTIMORE ORIOLES--Waived RHP Darren Holmes. Purchased the contract of LHP John Parrish from Rochester of the International League. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Claimed RHP Andy Larkin off waivers from the Cincinnati Reds. TEXAS RANGERS--Traded RHP Esteban Loaiza to Toronto for RHP Darwin Dubillan and INF Mike Young.

National League CHICAGO CUBS--Announced the resignation of Ed Lynch general manager. CINCINNATI REDS--Purchased the contracts of RHP Mark Wohlers and OF Brooks Kieschnick from Louisville of the International League. FLORIDA MARLINS--Optioned RHP Joe Strong to Calgary of the PCL. HOUSTON ASTROS--Agreed to terms with RHP Robert Stiehl and assigned him to Auburn of the New York-Penn League. LOS ANGELES DODGERS--Purchased contract of 1B Chris Donnels from Albuquerque of the PCL. Placed INF F.P. Santangelo on the 15-day disabled list, retroactive to July 17. Recalled RHP Al Reyes from Albuquerque. Optioned RHP Mike Judd to Albuquerque. MILWAUKEE BREWERS--Claimed OF Angel Echeverria off waivers from the Colorado Rockies. MONTREAL EXPOS--Placed RHP Tony Armas Jr. and OF Terry Jones on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled RHP Guillermo Mota and OF Milton Bradley from Ottawa of the International League. NEW YORK METS--Recalled RHP Jim Mann from Norfolk of the International League. Optioned LHP Bobby M. Jones to Norfolk. PITTSBURGH PIRATES--Recalled RHP Steve Sparks from Altoona of the Eastern League. Optioned OF Tike Redman to Nashville of the PCL. ST. LOUIS CARDINALS--Agreed to terms with RHP Blake Williams, SS Chase Voshell and OF Justin Woodrow.

Women's National Basketball Association MINNESOTA LYNX--Signed G Angela Aycock for the remainder of the season. PHOENIX MERCURY--Activated F Amanda Wilson from the injured list. Placed C Maria Stepanova on the injured list.

National Football League CHICAGO BEARS--Signed QB Shane Matthews to a one-year contract and WR Dez White to a three-year contract. CLEVELAND BROWNS--Signed WR Dennis Northcutt to a seven-year contract. DENVER BRONCOS--Signed OL Cooper Carlisle. Waived CB Jeremy Lincoln, WR LeRoy Fields, TE Frank Hartley, QB Steve Buck and DE Jason Chorak. DETROIT LIONS--Signed WR-KR Desmond Howard. GREEN BAY PACKERS--Signed TE Bubba Franks to a five-year contract, WR Mandrell Dean and CB Terrell Sutton. Waived CB Steve Johnson. NEW ENGLAND PATRIOTS--Waived LB John Eskridge. SAN DIEGO CHARGERS--Agreed to terms with OL Jason Thomas on a three-year contract. Cut RB Robert Cooper, DB Shad Criss, DB Rico Curtis, DE Seneca Knight and TE Leonard Stephens. SEATTLE SEAHAWKS--Released WR Mike Pritchard. TAMPA BAY BUCCANEERS--Signed RB Rabih Abdullah and WR Daniel Jones to one-year contracts. TENNESSEE TITANS--Signed LB Keith Bulluck and DE Byron Frisch. Released DL Mike Jones.

PATRIOT LEAGUE--Named Tom Byrnes assistant executive director for media relations, Michael McFarland assistant executive director for public relations and marketing and Molly Myers administrative intern. BENTLEY--Announced the retirement of Don Moorhead, assistant director of athletics. BRIDGEWATER STATE, MASS.--Reinstated Ken Duarte, women's volleyball coach. CAPITAL--Named Dwight Burgess men's soccer coach and Matt Croci men's assistant basketball and men's assistant soccer coach. CARSON-NEWMAN--Named Keith Kessinger baseball coach. DEPAUL--Named Andre Wakefield women's assistant basketball coach. FLORIDA INTERNATIONAL--Named Sergio Rouco men's assistant basketball coach. LOUISIANA-MONROE--Named Brad Holland interim baseball coach. NORTHWESTERN, IOWA--Named Barry Brandt and Dale Thompson interim athletic directors. QUINNIPIAC--Named Amanda Adams women's ice hockey coach. SEWANEE--Named Scott Baker baseball coach. TULANE--Named Shawn Finney men's basketball coach.
